This framework agreement for purchase orders concluded with a minimum annual amount of 200,000 euros excluding tax and a maximum annual amount of 1,000,000 euros excluding tax. It is concluded from the date of prescribed by service order established by the project owner and notified to the holder for a period of one year, tacitly renewable three times by the contracting authority, for periods of one year, without its total duration exceeding four years. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MONTLUÇON COMMUNITY. Summary: Management of Sludge Produced by the Montluçon Wastewater Treatment Plant. Description: Montluçon community operates an activated sludge wastewater treatment plant, rue de la Loue in Montluçon. This station, with a capacity of 88,830 PE on an annual daily average (131,667 PE at daily peak), adds value to agriculture its entire production of compliant sludge. The contents of trace elements or compounds contained in the sludge produced are generally well below the limit values ​​appearing in the authorization order concerning the recycling of sludge. So, Montluçon Community favors agricultural development. The sludge, before being spread, is previously thickened, dehydrated, and limed. The annual tonnage of raw limed sludge to be spread is of the order of more or less 7,500 tonnes. However in 2024, the STEU produced around 1,500 tonnes of limed sludge whose PCB contents exceeded the limit values ​​(accidental pollution). As this sludge could not be used for agricultural spreading, an alternative industrial recovery had to be implemented. in place. The service will therefore include: -the loading and transport of raw limed sludge on the plots of the spreading plan, -the recovery and spreading on the plots of the spreading plan of raw limed sludge, -analytical monitoring, agronomic, administrative and logistics of sludge, Finally, to take into account possible sludge pollution, alternative recovery methods that comply with regulations will also be included. Access.... Published Date: 2025-12-26. Closing Date: 2026-01-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Management of Sludge Produced by the Montluçon Wastewater Treatment Plant
output.Description: Montluçon community operates an activated sludge wastewater treatment plant, rue de la Loue in Montluçon. This station, with a capacity of 88,830 PE on an annual daily average (131,667 PE at daily peak), adds value to agriculture its entire production of compliant sludge. The contents of trace elements or compounds contained in the sludge produced are generally well below the limit values ​​appearing in the authorization order concerning the recycling of sludge. So, Montluçon Community favors agricultural development. The sludge, before being spread, is previously thickened, dehydrated, and limed. The annual tonnage of raw limed sludge to be spread is of the order of more or less 7,500 tonnes. However in 2024, the STEU produced around 1,500 tonnes of limed sludge whose PCB contents exceeded the limit values ​​(accidental pollution). As this sludge could not be used for agricultural spreading, an alternative industrial recovery had to be implemented. in place. The service will therefore include: -the loading and transport of raw limed sludge on the plots of the spreading plan, -the recovery and spreading on the plots of the spreading plan of raw limed sludge, -analytical monitoring, agronomic, administrative and logistics of sludge, Finally, to take into account possible sludge pollution, alternative recovery methods that comply with regulations will also be included. Access...

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: AIX-EN-PROVENCE TOWN HALL. Summary: Investigation Work on Jas De Bouffan Decors. Description: Services are paid by fixed prices. As part of the restoration and redevelopment of the Jas de Bouffan estate, project management for the historic monument (MH) parts - including the bastide - was entrusted to the ARCHIGEM group, Heritage architect agency. Following the initial diagnostics, urgent enclosed and covered work had to be undertaken in preparation for the opening of the site in June 2026. However, in parallel with the architectural diagnoses and the work carried out, to opening to the public in June 2026, on the painted decorations, it is necessary to carry out a series of surveys and investigations and to study in particular the stratigraphy of the paintings and painted joinery in targeted locations, making it possible to identify the chromatic states potentially from the Cézanne period and to establish a relative chronology. These investigations are essential to highlighting and dating the different rooms and decorations of the bastide, as well as to their connection on a technical and chronological level, in order to determine the final restoration options and the processes and methodology to be implemented INVESTIGATION WORK ON JAS DE BOUFFAN DECORS Services are regulated by prices flat rates. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: AIX-EN-PROVENCE TOWN HALL. Summary: Additional Work to Restore the Painted Decorations of the Leda Chamber of the Bastide of Jas De Bouffan. Description: As part of the restoration and redevelopment of the Jas de Bouffan estate, project management for the historic monument (MH) parts - including the bastide - was entrusted to the ARCHIGEM group, a heritage architect agency. At the end of the initial diagnostics, urgent enclosed and covered work had to be undertaken in preparation for the opening of the site in June 2025. The DRAC issued an authorization for this initial work, deferring to a later request the continuation of the operation on the interiors of the bastide. Still with a view to opening in June 2025, it was decided to open to visitors the large living room on the ground floor and Léda's bedroom, a room with painted decorations, on the 1st floor of the bastide. Specific authorizations distinct were made by the DRAC on these 2 pieces, requesting for each of them, the creation of a test zone before the definitive restoration. The duration of the contract is 14 weeks. This is an ordinary market. The services will be settled by a global and fixed price (DPGF) according to the stipulations of the act of commitment. The contract is concluded from its notification date and will end at the end of the guarantee of perfect completion. Prices are updatable. The contract provides for the payment of an advance, without the obligation to provide a financial guarantee to benefit from it. The contract is concluded from the date of notification until the end of the guarantee of perfect completion.... Published Date: 2025-12-26. Closing Date: 2026-01-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF CARCASSONNE. Summary: Public Service Delegation for the Design, Creation and Operation of the Heat Network in the Bastide Saint Louis District in the Community of Carcassonne. Description: The purpose of this consultation is to entrust a concessionaire with the design, financing, construction and operation of the heating network in the Bastide Saint Louis district of the city of Carcassonne. It follows a deliberation No. 037 dated June 26, 2025, by which the City of Carcassonne approved the principle of public service delegation. The Contract will be executed at the Concessionaire's own risk, in application of the general principles of concession law and of all legal and regulatory provisions in force at the time of its execution. In particular, the Concessionaire will assume a risk linked to the operation of the services, the part of the risk transferred being understood within the meaning of the second paragraph of Article L. 1121-1 of the Public Procurement Code. The value of the concession is €37 million excluding tax (cumulative turnover over the duration of the contract in the feasibility study). The Contract will be executed at the Concessionaire's own risk, in application of the general principles of concession law and of all legal and regulatory provisions in force at the time of its execution. In particular, the Concessionaire will assume a risk linked to the operation of the services, the part of the risk transferred being understood within the meaning of the second paragraph of Article L. 1121-1 of the Public Procurement Code. The value of the concession is €37 million excluding tax (cumulative turnover over the duration of the contract in the feasibility study). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ANYWHERE. Summary: Application Phase - Construction of Multi-Sport Equipment - Zac Python-Duvernois, Paris 20Th. Description: This consultation concerns the construction of a multi-sport facility, the Cité des Sports. Located in the ZAC Python Duvernois, in the heart of the green and sports belt of the 20th arrondissement of Paris, the "Cité des Sports" is a facility ambitious sportsman for clubs, associations and schools. The project aims to strengthen the sporting identity of the site and respond to local needs identified during a prior consultation process. The building is distinguished by its rich programming and the superposition of varied sports spaces, from the basement to the roof. This design, marked by its compactness and technical and functional complexity, integrates a structural system combining wood and concrete. The envelope of building, highly efficient, integrates numerous biosourced and low carbon materials. The project responds to the challenges of material sobriety and is part of an ambitious reuse approach. Covered enclosure Lot n°1: Covered enclosure includes services following: Earthworks, Structural work, Wooden framework and structure, Waterproofing roofing, Exterior joinery, Facades, Locksmithing, Metal framework, Demolitions Second Architectural Work Lot n°2: Second Architectural Work includes the following services: Interior wood joinery, Partitions, Linings, Suspended ceilings, Tiling, Earthenware, Flexible floors, Painting, Cleaning, Signage Heating - Ventilation - Air conditioning - Plumbing - Sanitary.... Published Date: 2025-12-26. Closing Date: 2026-02-06. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PROVENCE-ALPES-CÔTE D-AZUR REGION. Summary: Carrying out Preventive Archeology Excavations on the Construction Site of the Future Var Center High School in Luc En Provence (83). Description: This consultation concerns the carrying out of preventive archeology excavations prescribed by decree 2025-326 and its amending decree of December 5, 2025 on the construction site of the new Var center high school in the commune of Luc (83340). THE remains were identified in 3 sectors of the future area and come from 3 different ages: - To the south-west of the plot: middle Mesolithic (approximately 2,500m²) - To the north-east of the plot: Gallo-Roman (approximately 3,400m²) - To the south-east of the plot : second iron age (approximately 4000m²) After reading this report, the State services prescribed preventive archeology excavations by decree 2025-326 and the amending decree. The excavation methods (areas and methodologies) are recorded in this decree and its annexes including the scientific specifications and the excavation site plans. Published Date: 2025-12-26. Closing Date: 2026-01-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: AIX-EN-PROVENCE TOWN HALL. Summary: Investigation Work on Jas De Bouffan Decors. Description: Services are paid by fixed prices. As part of the restoration and redevelopment of the Jas de Bouffan estate, project management for the historic monument (MH) parts - including the bastide - was entrusted to the ARCHIGEM group, Heritage architect agency. Following the first diagnostics, urgent enclosed and covered work had to be undertaken with a view to opening the site in June 2026. However, in parallel with the architectural diagnostics and the work carried out, to opening to the public in June 2026, on the painted decorations, it is necessary to carry out a series of surveys and investigations and to study in particular the stratigraphy of the paintings and painted joinery in targeted locations, making it possible to identify the chromatic states potentially from the Cézanne period and to establish a relative chronology. These investigations are essential to highlighting and dating the different rooms and decorations of the bastide, as well as to their connection on a technical and chronological level, in order to determine the final restoration options and the processes and methodology to be implemented. Published Date: 2025-12-26. Closing Date: 2026-01-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Investigation Work on Jas De Bouffan Decors
output.Description: Services are paid by fixed prices. As part of the restoration and redevelopment of the Jas de Bouffan estate, project management for the historic monument (MH) parts - including the bastide - was entrusted to the ARCHIGEM group, Heritage architect agency. Following the first diagnostics, urgent enclosed and covered work had to be undertaken with a view to opening the site in June 2026. However, in parallel with the architectural diagnostics and the work carried out, to opening to the public in June 2026, on the painted decorations, it is necessary to carry out a series of surveys and investigations and to study in particular the stratigraphy of the paintings and painted joinery in targeted locations, making it possible to identify the chromatic states potentially from the Cézanne period and to establish a relative chronology. These investigations are essential to highlighting and dating the different rooms and decorations of the bastide, as well as to their connection on a technical and chronological level, in order to determine the final restoration options and the processes and methodology to be implemented

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: AIX-EN-PROVENCE TOWN HALL. Summary: Additional Work to Restore the Painted Decorations of the Leda Chamber of the Bastide of Jas De Bouffan. Description: As part of the restoration and redevelopment of the Jas de Bouffan estate, project management for the historic monument (MH) parts - including the bastide - was entrusted to the ARCHIGEM group, a heritage architect agency. At the end of the initial diagnostics, urgent enclosed and covered work had to be undertaken with a view to opening the site in June 2025. The DRAC issued an authorization for this initial work, referring to a later request the continuation of the operation on the interiors of the bastide. Still with a view to opening in June 2025, it was decided to open to visitors the large living room on the ground floor and Léda's bedroom, a room with painted decorations, on the 1st floor of the bastide. Specific authorizations distinct were made by the DRAC on these 2 pieces, requesting for each of them, the creation of a test zone before the definitive restoration. The duration of the contract is 14 weeks. This is an ordinary market. The services will be settled by a global and fixed price (DPGF) according to the stipulations of the act of commitment. The contract is concluded from its notification date and will end at the end of the guarantee of perfect completion. Prices are updatable. The contract provides for the payment of an advance, without the obligation to provide a financial guarantee to benefit from it. The contract is concluded from the date of notification until the end of the guarantee of perfect completion.... Published Date: 2025-12-26. Closing Date: 2026-01-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Additional Work to Restore the Painted Decorations of the Leda Chamber of the Bastide of Jas De Bouffan
output.Description: As part of the restoration and redevelopment of the Jas de Bouffan estate, project management for the historic monument (MH) parts - including the bastide - was entrusted to the ARCHIGEM group, a heritage architect agency. At the end of the initial diagnostics, urgent enclosed and covered work had to be undertaken with a view to opening the site in June 2025. The DRAC issued an authorization for this initial work, referring to a later request the continuation of the operation on the interiors of the bastide. Still with a view to opening in June 2025, it was decided to open to visitors the large living room on the ground floor and Léda's bedroom, a room with painted decorations, on the 1st floor of the bastide. Specific authorizations distinct were made by the DRAC on these 2 pieces, requesting for each of them, the creation of a test zone before the definitive restoration. The duration of the contract is 14 weeks. This is an ordinary market. The services will be settled by a global and fixed price (DPGF) according to the stipulations of the act of commitment. The contract is concluded from its notification date and will end at the end of the guarantee of perfect completion. Prices are updatable. The contract provides for the payment of an advance, without the obligation to provide a financial guarantee to benefit from it. The contract is concluded from the date of notification until the end of the guarantee of perfect completion...

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PUBLIC SOCIETY OF MARSEILLAIS SCHOOLS. Summary: Single-Attribute Framework Agreement Relating to the Assessment of the Overall Environmental Quality of Construction, Rehabilitation and Renovation Projects for School Groups. Description: The purpose of the market is to select a partner offering a system for evaluating, monitoring and enhancing the quality of the Company's real estate projects according to various environmental, social, societal and economic criteria. This assessment of the quality of the projects will be made on the basis of one or more standards developed by the candidate, who must justify: - their adequacy with the parameters listed in this document in article 1.5; - their suitability for specificities of the projects carried out by the Company (typology, new/rehabilitation, climate, etc.). The framework agreement is single-award and with purchase orders. It is concluded without a minimum commitment amount and with a maximum commitment amount of 900,000 euro(s) excluding tax. over the duration of the framework agreement. The duration of the framework agreement is one (1) year, renewable three (3) times by tacit agreement up to a maximum of four (4) years. The missions covered by this framework agreement and the technical specifications are described in the document unique. Published Date: 2025-12-26. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Single-Attribute Framework Agreement Relating to the Assessment of the Overall Environmental Quality of Construction, Rehabilitation and Renovation Projects for School Groups
output.Description: The purpose of the market is to select a partner offering a system for evaluating, monitoring and enhancing the quality of the Company's real estate projects according to various environmental, social, societal and economic criteria. This assessment of the quality of the projects will be made on the basis of one or more standards developed by the candidate, who must justify: - their adequacy with the parameters listed in this document in article 1.5; - their suitability for specificities of the projects carried out by the Company (typology, new/rehabilitation, climate, etc.). The framework agreement is single-award and with purchase orders. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: LOUVRE MUSEUM. Summary: Preparatory Work for the Archaeological Excavations of the Esplanade Saint-Germain L-Auxerrois.. Description: PREPARATORY WORK FOR THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL EXCAVATIONS OF THE ESPLANADE SAINT-GERMAIN L-AUXERROIS ON BEHALF OF THE PUBLIC ESTABLISHMENT OF THE LOUVRE MUSEUM. The service, subject of the contract, is part of the Louvre Nouvelle Renaissance project. THE services will consist of preparatory work for archaeological excavations in the Saint-Germain esplanade sector. This work aims to support INRAP in its diagnosis, which aims to understand the conservation potential archaeological levels to the right of the Saint-Germain l'Auxerrois esplanade. This involves highlighting or not the presence of remains, characterizing them, obtaining information on their level of appearance, on the thickness of the sequence stratigraphic, and on the level of appearance of the substrate. The specific objective is therefore to support INRAP in carrying out the excavations necessary to carry out its diagnosis. This work includes in particular: - site preparation: tracing networks, site signage, setting up a camp, a fenced area and signage throughout the duration of the site (preparatory work and archaeological excavations), carrying out bailiff's reports; - all the means necessary for the work described in the specifications (including restoration).. Published Date: 2025-12-25. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Preparatory Work for the Archaeological Excavations of the Esplanade Saint-Germain L-Auxerrois.
output.Description: PREPARATORY WORK FOR THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL EXCAVATIONS OF THE ESPLANADE SAINT-GERMAIN L-AUXERROIS ON BEHALF OF THE PUBLIC ESTABLISHMENT OF THE LOUVRE MUSEUM. The service, subject of the contract, is part of the Louvre Nouvelle Renaissance project. THE services will consist of preparatory work for archaeological excavations in the Saint-Germain esplanade sector. This work aims to support INRAP in its diagnosis, which aims to understand the conservation potential archaeological levels to the right of the Saint-Germain l'Auxerrois esplanade. This involves highlighting or not the presence of remains, characterizing them, obtaining information on their level of appearance, on the thickness of the sequence stratigraphic, and on the level of appearance of the substrate. The specific objective is therefore to support INRAP in carrying out the excavations necessary to carry out its diagnosis. This work includes in particular: - site preparation: tracing networks, site signage, setting up a camp, a fenced area and signage throughout the duration of the site (preparatory work and archaeological excavations), carrying out bailiff's reports; - all the means necessary for the work described in the specifications (including restoration).

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SAGEM. Summary: Redevelopment Work on Caf Premises (83130 La Garde) - Lots 3, 4 and 6.. Description: Following the purchase of the former CAF premises, SAGEM wishes to redevelop the ground floor to accommodate their new offices. The R+1 and the R+2 will be sold individually in order to accommodate offices. On the facade, the openings will be maintained however the glazing on the South, West and North facade of the ground floor is changed in order to adapt to the re-partitioning. The aesthetics of the facade do not change, the replaced glazing is made of the same materials as the originals. A helical staircase is added to the South facade in order to provide an additional emergency exit to the R+1 and R+2. It is a staircase partitioned into a solid concrete wall covered with a white coating in order to follow the aesthetics of the original project. This consultation concerns the lots following: Lot NO 3: Structural work, masonry Lot NO 4: Cladding, renovation Lot NO 6: Exterior joinery, metalwork. Published Date: 2025-12-24. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ILE DE FRANCE MOBILITIES. Summary: Traffic Light Signaling Market for the T13 Tramway Operation Phase 2. Description: The purpose of this contract is: • Carrying out studies, software developments and hardware that may be necessary for validation tests; • The supply and installation of three-color light signaling installations and site management; • There supply and installation of traffic light signaling equipment (cabinets, cabling, controllers, masts, signaling lanterns, etc.) including electrical connection and consultation process, outside the platform; • Supply and installation of equipment road signaling (lights (SAC, R17, etc.), electrical connection, etc.) on the platform (excluding train detection loops and equipment dedicated to railway signaling); • Drawing from SLT networks (cables, connections, etc.); • The programming of intersection controllers, adjustment of light parameters, approach times, interfaces with GIS and detection, etc. ; • Scheduling of fire controllers and implementation of priority strategies for public transport; • THE factory and on-site tests, commissioning of equipment; • Training of the operator's teams. All of the massifs hosting this equipment will have been carried out by the urban infrastructure markets (INFRA) according to the definitions center distance, effort and load descents defined during the execution studies.. Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-02-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Traffic Light Signaling Market for the T13 Tramway Operation Phase 2

All of the massifs hosting this equipment will have been carried out by the urban infrastructure markets (INFRA) according to the definitions center distance, effort and load descents defined during the execution studies.

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PUBLIC SOCIETY OF MARSEILLAIS SCHOOLS. Summary: Overall Performance Contract for the Rehabilitation and Construction Operation of the Les Prairies School Group - 13013 Marseille - Applications Phase. Description: This consultation follows the publication of a previous contract which the contracting authority declared without action, in accordance with articles R. 2185-1 and R. 2385-1 of the public procurement code, due to a redefinition of the need. There initial consultation bore the number 2025-0052 and was the subject of declaration letters without action dated 03/12/2025. This procedure is carried out autonomously and independently of the initial consultation. Considering the objectives of performance of the project management on this operation, the Company has opted for the award of a global performance contract in accordance with the provisions of article L. 2173-3 of the Public Procurement Code. The choice of such a mode of devolution leads the non-division of the market and, de facto, the use of a single market. This global public performance contract includes services of: - Design and execution of rehabilitation, extension, construction and development works exteriors and temporary buildings where applicable. - Operation and maintenance of the equipment, including those allowing monitoring and compliance with performance. It concerns the rehabilitation and construction operation of the Les school group PRAIRIES, 35 chemin de Saint-Mître in Four de Buze- 13013 Marseille. The project will include 13 classes (5 kindergarten classes and 8 elementary classes). This project is described in the program summary note and the.... Published Date: 2025-12-24. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF MAMOUDZOU (976). Summary: Project Management for the Development of the Mamoudzou Seafront.. Description: Project management for the development of the Mamoudzou seafront. Project management for the development of the Mamoudzou seafront. This market aims to deploy a lively pedestrian promenade along Mamoudzou Bay starting from the Pointe Mahabou to the Multimodal Interchange Hub. This development first requires the implementation of an embankment with a width of 45m on the side sea in the extension of the national road. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CITY OF COURBEVOIE. Summary: Mission of Project Management Support and Foundation Guard of Bécon. Description: This consultation concerns MOE missions relating to the supports and foundations of the future footbridges to be built in widening the Pont des XV Perches and the Pont des Bruyères which make it possible to cross the railway beam of the line transilian. These bridges are located in the commune of Courbevoie, on the RD12 in the immediate vicinity of the future Grand Paris station. The consultation will relate to a non-allotment flat-rate market. The missions of the firm phase will be: - studies PRO level of the foundation of the southern support of the XV Perche footbridge, - PRO level studies of the northern support of the Bruyères footbridge and its foundation. In fact, the area available for the creation of this support is strongly constrained by the position of doors and ventilation grilles on the station facade. As an optional installment: - Optional tranche 01: The visa of the execution documents of the COREA GPE company - Optional tranche 02: The work execution management (DET), reception operations (AOR) The deadline for completing the TF is 4 months, due in June 2026. Candidates must have the OPQIBI qualification certificate or equivalent: 1819 complex bridge engineering and 1233 foundation studies Mission of project management support and foundation guard of Bécon This consultation concerns MOE missions relating to the supports and foundations of future footbridges to be carried out in widening.... Description: The framework agreement will be executed by issuing purchase orders. Each lot will be awarded separately. The services are regulated by unit and fixed prices. The estimated amounts are indicative and include all of the renewal periods. This contract concerns a framework agreement with a purchase order for the development, maintenance and upkeep of recycling centers and related sites in Bordeaux Métropole, whatever their situation, which must: - Be compliant with the “Production Guide” relating to compensatory rainwater sanitation solutions in BORDEAUX METROPOLE. - In all cases be the subject of a special study - Obtain the agreement of the Project Manager (Bordeaux Metropolis). The market is divided into two lots: - Lot 1: projects for small and medium-sized interventions less than 150,000 euro(s) excluding tax - Lot 2?: construction sites for major interventions exceeding 150,000 euro(s) excluding tax The start date of the market is given as an indication Construction site for small and medium interventions Construction site for small and medium interventions<br> Construction site for major interventions Construction site for major interventions<br> Doc Title: Framework voucher agreement order for development, maintenance and maintenance work for recycling centers and related sites Contract Type: works. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PUBLIC COMPANY OF MARSEILLE SCHOOLS. Summary: Overall Performance Contract for the Rehabilitation and Construction Operation of the Les Prairies School Group - 13013 Marseille - Applications Phase. Description: This consultation follows the publication of a previous contract which the contracting authority declared without action, in accordance with articles R. 2185-1 and R. 2385-1 of the public procurement code, due to a redefinition of the need. There initial consultation bore the number 2025-0052 and was the subject of declaration letters without action dated 03/12/2025. This procedure is carried out autonomously and independently of the initial consultation. Considering the objectives of performance of the project management on this operation, the Company has opted for the award of a global performance contract in accordance with the provisions of article L. 2173-3 of the Public Procurement Code. The choice of such a mode of devolution leads the non-division of the market and, de facto, the use of a single market. This global public performance contract includes services of: - Design and execution of rehabilitation, extension, construction and development works exteriors and temporary buildings where applicable. - Operation and maintenance of the equipment, including those allowing monitoring and compliance with performance. It concerns the rehabilitation and construction operation of the Les school group PRAIRIES, 35 chemin de Saint-Mître in Four de Buze- 13013 Marseille. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COMMUNITY OF COMMUNITIES COUNTRY OF EVIAN VALLEY OF ABUNDANCE. Summary: Evacuation, Treatment and Recovery of Sludge from the Abondance Wastewater Treatment Plant. Description: The Pays d'Evian Vallée d'Abondance Community of Communes (C.C.P.E.V.A.) ensures project management of the sanitation networks and their associated works. It thus manages around 450 km of networks, around forty lifting stations and nine stations treatment plant, the largest of which is the Abondance wastewater treatment plant (26,300EH) This framework agreement aims to: transport and treat, by composting, the sludge from the Abondance wastewater treatment plant (STEP) and to recover it in standardized compost in compliance with the provisions of standard NFU 44-095. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MAIRIE DE LA TALAUDIERE. Summary: Project Management Mission for the Rehabilitation and Extension of the Nursery Building. Description: The town of Talaudière (7,100 inhabitants) has a crèche with 36 cradles located in a municipal building and managed by an association "Les Coissous". The building is located in an early childhood center with a school in the immediate vicinity. nursery school, a kindergarten, an early childhood relay and a branch of the leisure center. The building built in 1994 underwent an extension in 2003 and the creation of a kitchen adjoining this extension in 2014. Despite its connection to the network recent urban heat (October 2024), the building remains very energy-intensive and requires thermal renovation. In addition, with the PMI building regulations becoming effective in September 2026, it is obligatory to bring the building up to standard. Finally, the crèche has dormitories upstairs, very partitioned living spaces and half-levels that no longer meet PMR standards and therefore requires an in-depth overhaul. Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-01-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Project Management Mission for the Rehabilitation and Extension of the Nursery Building
output.Description: The town of Talaudière (7,100 inhabitants) has a crèche with 36 cradles located in a municipal building and managed by an association "Les Coissous". The building is located in an early childhood center with a school in the immediate vicinity. nursery school, a kindergarten, an early childhood relay and a branch of the leisure center. The building built in 1994 underwent an extension in 2003 and the creation of a kitchen adjoining this extension in 2014. Despite its connection to the network recent urban heat (October 2024), the building remains very energy-intensive and requires thermal renovation. In addition, with the PMI building regulations becoming effective in September 2026, it is obligatory to bring the building up to standard. Finally, the crèche has dormitories upstairs, very partitioned living spaces and half-levels that no longer meet PMR standards and therefore requires an in-depth overhaul

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOULOUSE METROPOLE. Summary: 25M0486Pa_Mhd_As_Taking Aerial Images, Orthophotography and Related Services in the Metropolis Territory. Description: An aerial acquisition campaign (nadiral and oblique images, airborne LiDAR) and production of the following data over the entire territory of Toulouse Métropole: 1. True color and near-infrared orthophotography at the 5 cm ground pixel (true ortho). 2. DEM at 50 cm intervals, DEM/MNS at 50 cm intervals, from LiDAR and/or photogrammetry. 3. LiDAR point cloud (LAS/LAZ) classified (soil, low/medium/high vegetation, buildings) and compliant with ASPRS LAS 1.4/1.5 codes. 4. Textured 3D photomesh (mesh georeferenced from nadiral/oblique images and DSM), delivered in open formats (OGC 3D Tiles, Esri I3S/SLPK, OBJ/DAE/OSGB) and compatible with 2D/3D GIS use. Services include acquisition, stereopreparation, aerotriangulation, orthorectification, mosaicking, radiometric corrections, LiDAR classification, generation of a 3D photomesh and creation/delivery of the products described with their metadata. Published Date: 2025-12-24. Closing Date: 2026-02-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: 25M0486Pa_Mhd_As_Taking Aerial Images, Orthophotography and Related Services in the Metropolis Territory
output.Description: An aerial acquisition campaign (nadiral and oblique images, airborne LiDAR) and production of the following data over the entire territory of Toulouse Métropole: 1. True color and near-infrared orthophotography at the 5 cm ground pixel (true ortho). 2. DEM at 50 cm intervals, DEM/MNS at 50 cm intervals, from LiDAR and/or photogrammetry. 3. LiDAR point cloud (LAS/LAZ) classified (soil, low/medium/high vegetation, buildings) and compliant with ASPRS LAS 1.4/1.5 codes. 4. Textured 3D photomesh (mesh georeferenced from nadiral/oblique images and DSM), delivered in open formats (OGC 3D Tiles, Esri I3S/SLPK, OBJ/DAE/OSGB) and compatible with 2D/3D GIS use. Services include acquisition, stereopreparation, aerotriangulation, orthorectification, mosaicking, radiometric corrections, LiDAR classification, generation of a 3D photomesh and creation/delivery of the products described with their metadata

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CNES SIDE OF GRAND PIC ST LOUP. Summary: Collection Service for Voluntary Contribution Columns for Glass 2026. Description: Its purpose is the collection of raw household cullet in columns from voluntary contributions (4 m3 columns all equipped with a simple rotating hook grip opening by feeler or drop side or rotating and provided with an automatic closure). In view of the economic context of the historic site of the Languedoc glassworks processing center in Vergèze (30310), the community is proposing a BPU with 3 possible sites for the deposit of glass: -The deposit of glass collected from the Languedoc glassworks in Vergèze. -Depositing the glass collected on the load break platform located near Vauvert with the candidate being required to be affiliated with OI Manufacturing. -Depositing the glass collected at the OI glassworks in Béziers.. Description: As part of the restoration and redevelopment of the Cézanne workshop (listed monument), project management was entrusted to the ARCHIGEM group, a heritage architect agency. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: ISÈRE ENERGY TERRITORY (38). Summary: Mission to Control Energy Renovation Operations of Buildings Subject to Mandatory Inspection as Part of their Evaluation in Cee (Relaunch). Description: The purpose of this framework agreement is to provide control services for renovation operations of public buildings in which TE38 carries out the valorization of Energy Savings Certificates (when it plays an active incentive role or in within the framework of grouping agreements on behalf of communities). Operations subject to controls to enable EECs to be obtained are governed by the decree of September 28, 2021 relating to controls within the framework of the certificate system. energy savings, they are summarized in the Unit Price Schedule (BPU). The demand is currently estimated at around a hundred annual checks on places of operation such as public buildings spread across the entire territory. Isère. This estimate is likely to increase to the extent that TE38 intensifies its activities to respond to the growing demand from communities on the one hand, and to the increase in control obligations set by the ministry on the other hand. This batch is relaunched following the declaration of infructuousness made during the first procedure, in accordance with article R.2185-1 of the Public Procurement Code.. Published Date: 2025-12-24. output.Description: The purpose of this framework agreement is to provide control services for renovation operations of public buildings in which TE38 carries out the valorization of Energy Savings Certificates (when it plays an active incentive role or in within the framework of grouping agreements on behalf of communities). Operations subject to controls to enable EECs to be obtained are governed by the decree of September 28, 2021 relating to controls within the framework of the certificate system. energy savings, they are summarized in the Unit Price Schedule (BPU). The demand is currently estimated at around a hundred annual checks on places of operation such as public buildings spread across the entire territory. Isère. This estimate is likely to increase to the extent that TE38 intensifies its activities to respond to the growing demand from communities on the one hand, and to the increase in control obligations set by the ministry on the other hand. This batch is relaunched following the declaration of infructuousness made during the first procedure, in accordance with article R.2185-1 of the Public Procurement Code.

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MIXED HOUSEHOLD WASTE PROCESSING UNION OF NORTHERN SEINE-ET-MARNE. Summary: Awareness and Engaging Communication Program, Based on a Territorial Diagnosis, Aiming to Improve the Sorting Performance of Individual Housing in the Four Adhered Territories.... Description: AWARENESS AND ENGAGING COMMUNICATION PROGRAM, BASED ON A TERRITORIAL DIAGNOSIS, AIMING TO IMPROVE THE SORTING PERFORMANCE OF INDIVIDUAL HOUSING IN THE FOUR ADHERED TERRITORIES... This public contract is a continuation of the 2024 Call for Collection Projects, led by Citeo and Adelphe, for which SMITOM du Nord Seine-et-Marne and its members were the winners. This call for projects aims to optimize the selective collection of household packaging and graphic papers, by improving the quality of the sorting process and reducing the refusal rate at sorting centers. The actions planned in this framework, focusing primarily on dense collective housing sectors, a large part of the SMITOM territory - made up of areas predominantly individual and low-density suburban housing - remains uncovered. The purpose of this market is to complete the action program initially planned by specifically targeting suburban housing. It aims to set up a system diagnosis, communication and awareness-raising, consistent with the lessons and tools developed within the framework of the AAP Collection, but adapted to the specificities of individual housing. Like AAP Collecte, this market targeting housing suburban housing is part of the specific objective OS 2.6 Promote the transition towards a circular economy of the Île-de-France and Seine Basin Regional Program. It provides in particular: •A field behavioral diagnosis, carried out with a representative sample of suburban households, in order to measure actual sorting practices, identify the most frequent errors and.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: RATP. Summary: Republic Station Rehabilitation Projectlot: Supply, Installation and Maintenance of 3 Life Bases and Site Installations. Description: As part of the rehabilitation and desaturation work at République station. République station is located on the edge of the 3rd, 10th and 11th arrondissement of Paris and distributes 5 metro lines: L3/L5/L8/L9/L11 for a total surface area of approximately 14,000 m². The work consists of waterproofing almost all of the spaces, redeveloping the entire station, restoring smooth flow and desaturating the spaces while improving the passenger journey. The project will also allow upgrading the station in terms of fire safety, accessibility and security. The purpose of this contract is the installation, supply, development, maintenance and removal work of the 3 life bases located near the Place de la République in Paris for the station rehabilitation operation, on locations authorized by the city, in the 3 districts concerned. The 3 life bases of the project are named according to their geographical area: -Life base n°1 Léon Jouhaux for companions men composed of 18 bungalows on 2 levels located rue Léon Jouhaux in the immediate vicinity of the fire station (75010) -Life base n°2 Malta for MOE/CDP offices composed of 16 bungalows on 2 levels located rue de Malte (75011) -Life base n°3 Elisabeth, for female companions and company management made up of 6 bungalows in the DRC located Passage Sainte Elisabeth (75003) The tenderer acknowledges being fully informed that the work is.... input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: LOIRE ATLANTIQUE DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL. Summary: Reconstruction of the Auguste Mailloux College in Loroux-Bottereau. Description: Each lot will be awarded separately. Services are paid by fixed prices. The departmental college plan, updated in 2019, highlighted the need to rebuild the Auguste Mailloux college in Loroux-Bottereau. THE future establishment, with a capacity of 28 divisions, will be rebuilt on a plot directly adjoining the current college. The establishment will include an educational inclusion unit (ULIS), premises intended for administration, teachers, a center health, maintenance premises as well as 3 staff accommodation. External developments necessary for the proper functioning of the establishment will complete this reconstruction: access, forecourt, parking. In total, the surface area is estimated at 4,700 m² of useful surfaces. Old buildings will be deconstructed and asbestos removed The portion of the financial envelope allocated to the work is 14,997,100 euro(s) excluding tax (value September 2023). Delivery of the new college (teaching building-phase 1) is planned for the start of the 2028 school year. At the end of the various stages of demolition-asbestos removal then reconstruction, the overall completion of the operation will take place in the first quarter of 2030 VRD-Road Networks Miscellaneous Big work Frame Waterproofing Cover Facade coverings Exterior joinery Locksmith Partitions / Linings False ceilings Interior joinery Floor coverings Painting / Cleaning Heating Ventilation Plumbing Electricity CFO / CF.... Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: S3T'EC. Summary: Sorting Household Waste and Recycling from S3T'Ec. Description: The contract is a multi-awardee framework agreement with purchase orders aimed at sorting recyclable household waste from S3T-ec. Sorting recyclable household waste • Reception and sorting of recyclable household waste from S3T-ec; • THE conditioning of recyclable materials resulting from sorting with a view to their recovery; • Characterization of incoming flows as well as sorting refusals; • Organizing visits to the sorting center; • Administrative management (including weighing) of different flows received, sorted and evacuated, as well as reporting to S3T-ec; • Transport and processing of sorting refusals until the commissioning of the S3T-ec UVE; • Reception and sorting of recyclable household waste from S3T-ec collected in multimaterials. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GIRONDE DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL. Summary: Annual Maintenance 2026 of the Ship Sébastien Vauban. Description: This framework agreement corresponds to a recurring need because each year the ship SEBASTIEN VAUBAN, managed by the Departmental Maritime Transport Department, must be subject to maintenance. This technical stop is broken down into 3 parts which correspond to 3 maintenance lots: Lot 1 boilermaking, lot 2 mechanics, lot 3 painting. Each lot will be the subject of a separate framework agreement. Companies will be able to make proposals for one or more lots and will have to respond to the lot(s) of their choice in its (their) entirety. The delivery time for the service will be specified in each order form. The services will take place from 03/09/2026 to 03/27/2026. A drying period of 10 working days, entry and exit from the dry dock, will be integrated into this period. The place of execution of the work will be at the Grand Port Maritime de Bordeaux, Bassin à floating in Bacalan, form 1. A visit is planned for the 3 lots on December 1, 2025 at 8:30 a.m. in Blaye Lot n°1 Boilermaking Lot n°2 Mechanical Lot n°3 Painting Doc Title: Annual maintenance 2026 of the ship Sébastien Vauban Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2025-12-31. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: AGRIPARIS SEINE. Summary: Composite Framework Agreement, Relating to the Monitoring and Evaluation of the “Seine Nourricière” Territorial Demonstrator and the Actions of the Agriparis Seine Association.. Description: This contract concerns a single-award composite framework agreement to support the AgriParis Seine association in its mission as an observatory of sustainable agri-food sectors. Particularly for the monitoring, evaluation and replicability of actions implemented in the “Seine Nourricière” territorial demonstrator. This winning action program from the Banque des Territoires aims to strengthen the sustainability of local food systems, to structure agricultural sectors and to promote replicability of actions in other territories. This framework agreement aims to provide the beneficiary with contractual support allowing them to access intellectual services of project management assistance and project management for the carrying out studies and leading consultation meetings. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PARIS AIRPORTS. Summary: Framework Agreement Missions for Environmental Impact Studies and Public Inquiry Files. Description: The purpose of this consultation is to award a framework agreement with multi-awarded purchase orders for the execution of environmental impact study services and public inquiry files for Aéroports de Paris. It is planned to contract with 3 holders. The stipulations of these consultation regulations concern a framework agreement for purchase orders and subsequent contracts. A threshold of €25,000 will limit the placing of purchase orders and the signing of contracts. subsequent ones. The consistency and scope of each mission will be specified in the specifications or in the annexes allowing the edition of orders. It will be usable for all departments of Aéroports de Paris Impact study missions environmental and public inquiry files The purpose of this consultation is to award a framework agreement for purchase orders and subsequent multi-awardee contracts (3 holders), to produce studies relating to the procedures regulatory environmental requirements necessary for the completion of projects, in accordance with the regulations in force, in particular those provided for by the environmental code. Framework agreement with a re-competition threshold of €25,000 Doc Title: Framework Agreement Environmental impact study and public inquiry files missions Contract Type: services. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN OF SAINTE-MAXIME. Summary: Complete Renovation of the Positive Cold Production of the Central Kitchen. Description: The project consists of carrying out a complete renovation of the positive cold production of the municipal central kitchen of Sainte-Maxime. The intervention aims to completely replace the existing installation operating on R448A, which has become obsolete, with one new installation operating with HFO R1234yf fluid, classified A2L, compliant with the future obligations of the F-Gas III regulations. The installation must make it possible to continuously ensure the required temperature levels in the various refrigeration rooms, without significant interruption of activity in the central kitchen. The services will be remunerated by application of the overall fixed price as specified in the breakdown of the overall and fixed price, which will be reported in the act of commitment when of the attribution COMPLETE RENOVATION OF THE POSITIVE COLD PRODUCTION OF THE CENTRAL KITCHEN The project consists of carrying out a complete renovation of the positive cold production of the municipal central kitchen of Sainte-Maxime. Summary: Issuance of Collective Sanitation Service Certificates, Compliance Checks of Connections to the Public Collective Sanitation Network in the Casa Territory. Summary: Project Management for the Rehabilitation of the Port Infrastructure of the Diélette Port and Development of the Diélette Outlet. Description: The services consist of carrying out project management missions for the rehabilitation of the port infrastructure of the Diélette port as well as the development of the Diélette outlet. The estimate of the amount of work established during the preliminary studies is 4,500,000 euro(s) excluding tax. The project includes the following program elements: - Resurfacing of the protective riprap of the north dike and the west jetty following the erosion observed since the creation of the port (estimate: 1 800,000 euro(s) excluding tax); - Development of the Diélette outlet, currently made up of a cascade of riprap, into a pool pass more passable by identified fish species (estimate: 1,400,000 euro(s) excluding tax); - Raising the wall submersible of the pleasure basin by means of perforated boxes in order to limit the swell in the marina, including all the work necessary for the optimal operation of the folding door (estimate: 1,300,000 euro(s) excluding tax) Project management for the rehabilitation of the port infrastructure of the Diélette port and development of the Diélette outlet The services consist of carrying out project management missions for the rehabilitation of port infrastructure at the Diélette port. as well as the development of the Diélette outlet. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CITY OF SEVRAN. Summary: Geotechnical Study Mission for the City. Description: The services provided under this contract aim to carry out soil studies, for new construction work, the extension of existing buildings in the municipal territory of Sevran. These services are carried out in accordance with the standard NF P 94-500 of November 2013 and the decree of July 22, 2020 defining the content of the geotechnical studies to be carried out in areas exposed to the phenomenon of differential ground movement following drought and rehydration of floors. The incumbent will therefore be responsible for carrying out studies on the nature of the soil on behalf of the City of Sevran. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: RTE ELECTRICITY TRANSMISSION NETWORK. Summary: 24135-2 - Installation of Auxiliary Services 2026-2031. Description: This contract concerns the installation of equipment making up the auxiliary services located in RTE substations (batteries, rectifiers, boxes). The details of the different installation services will be described, during the RFQ, in the Specifications. General Technical Clauses applicable to the installation of the equipment making up the Auxiliary Services. The market includes: - preliminary studies, orders and receipt of materials (mainly on supply markets which are RTE holder); - installation and connection work on new equipment or replacement of equipment for auxiliary services in RTE substations; - commissioning tests; - removal of equipment to be replaced. The materials of auxiliary services concerned are: - Stationary lead-acid batteries (48 V and 125 V batteries); - 48 V and 125 V rectifier block batteries (BBR); - Batteries on mobile energy workshops (AME); - Separate rectifiers (chargers) and 48V and 125V monoblocks; - Battery Switch Boxes (CIB) allowing you to connect a battery or an emergency rectifier; - Battery cable expansion boxes. All or part of these services will be carried out in TST BT. For apply for this market, only B2V authorization is mandatory. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: LOIRE ATLANTIC DEPARTMENTAL COUNCIL. Summary: Reconstruction of the Auguste Mailloux College in Loroux-Bottereau. Description: Each lot will be awarded separately. Services are paid by fixed prices. The departmental college plan, updated in 2019, highlighted the need to rebuild the Auguste Mailloux college in Loroux-Bottereau. THE future establishment, with a capacity of 28 divisions, will be rebuilt on a plot directly adjoining the current college. The establishment will include an educational inclusion unit (ULIS), premises intended for administration, teachers, a center health, maintenance premises as well as 3 staff accommodation. External developments necessary for the proper functioning of the establishment will complete this reconstruction: access, forecourt, parking. In total, the surface area is estimated at 4,700 m² of useful surfaces. The old buildings will be deconstructed and asbestos removed. The portion of the financial envelope allocated to the work is 14,997,100 euro(s) excluding tax (value September 2023). Delivery of the new college (teaching building-phase 1) is planned for the start of the 2028 school year. At the end of the various stages of demolition-asbestos removal then reconstruction, the overall completion of the operation will take place in the first quarter of 2030. Published Date: 2025-12-23. Closing Date: 2026-02-12. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Reconstruction of the Auguste Mailloux College in Loroux-Bottereau

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: SMO PROCESSING HOUSEHOLD WASTE. Summary: Awareness and Engaging Communication Program, Based on a Territorial Diagnosis, Aiming to Improve the Sorting Performance of Individual Housing in the Smitom Nord Territory 77. Description: This public market is a continuation of the 2024 Call for Collection Projects, led by Citeo and Adelphe, for which SMITOM du Nord Seine-et-Marne and its members were the winners. This call for projects aims to optimize the collection selection of household packaging and graphic papers, by improving the quality of the sorting process and reducing the refusal rate at sorting centers. The actions planned in this framework, focusing primarily on dense collective housing sectors, a large part of the SMITOM territory - made up of predominantly individual and low-density residential areas - remains uncovered. The purpose of this contract is to complete the action program initially planned by specifically targeting suburban housing. It aims to set up a diagnostic, communication and awareness system, consistent with the lessons and tools developed within the framework of the AAP Collection, but adapted to the specificities of the habitat individual. Like the AAP Collecte, this market targeting suburban housing is part of the specific objective OS 2.6 Promoting the transition to a circular economy of the Île-de-France and Seine Basin Regional Program. He plans in particular: • A field behavioral diagnosis, carried out with a representative sample of suburban households, in order to measure actual sorting practices, identify the most frequent errors and.... output.Description: The consultation, as set out in this call for applications, is part of an amicable transfer of built land belonging to the City of Cavaillon. Its purpose is to encourage real estate projects to develop the private stock in a neighborhood currently hosting exclusively social rental housing, and thereby diversifying the offer with the aim of greater social diversity. The requirement for social diversity is a strong challenge of the program in this district which today has 100% social rental housing. Consequently, the municipality and the NPNRU partners are awaiting a project to produce housing for home ownership eligible for 0% and free access loans.

The market takes the form of a mixed market, with a lump sum part, and a purchase order part: - Lump sum part of the market: evaluation of the value of the land in compliance with the methods described by the CCTP - Framework agreement part with purchase orders: evaluation of eviction and transfer compensation, updating of expertise, critical analysis of an expertise carried out by a third party

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: HIGHWAYS IN THE SOUTH OF FRANCE (ASF). Summary: Creation of a Wastewater Pumping Station and its Pumping Network. Description: Restoration of the gravity wastewater network by the creation of a very deep discharge station capable of ensuring a peak flow of 600 m3/h, the creation of a discharge pipe allowing connection downstream to the existing network (Work partly carried out using trenchless techniques: microtunneling, auger drilling). Lot n°1 - Pipes Lot 1 - Pipelines consists of the implementation of: the diversion of the DN300 cast iron discharge pipe coming from the PR Condamine over an indicative length of 275 m, from a gravity pipe upstream of the discharge station after interceptions of the existing collectors (gravity and discharge) to the discharge station to be created (Lot n°3) with an indicative length of 190m in PRV 400. The route provides for a passage under the Tram line 2 track and a passage under RM132 roads (auger drilling); a discharge pipe from the new discharge station (Lot n°3) to the microtunneling well (Lot n°2)) on a indicative linear length of 100 m in PEHD 450; a discharge pipe from the microtunneling well (Lot no. 2) to the delivery point of the Montpellier Méditerranée Métropole water authority over an indicative length of 215 m in PEHD 450; rerouting of the existing pipeline on Rue Alexander Fleming over an indicative length of 230 m in PRV 200 with recovery of 6 connections. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COTENTIN AGGLOMERATION COMMUNITY. Summary: Project Management for the Rehabilitation of the Port Infrastructure of the Diélette Port and Development of the Diélette Outlet. Description: The services consist of carrying out project management missions for the rehabilitation of the port infrastructure of the Diélette port as well as the development of the Diélette outlet. The estimate of the amount of work established during the preliminary studies is 4,500,000 euro(s) excluding tax. The project includes the following program elements: - Reloading of the protective riprap of the north seawall and the west jetty following the erosion observed since the creation of the port (estimate: 1 800,000 euro(s) excluding tax); - Development of the Diélette outlet, currently made up of a cascade of riprap, into a pool pass more passable by identified fish species (estimate: 1,400,000 euro(s) excluding tax); - Raising the wall submersible of the pleasure basin by means of perforated boxes in order to limit the swell in the marina, including all the work necessary for the optimal operation of the folding door (estimate: 1,300,000 euro(s) excluding tax). Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MUNICIPALITY OF SAINT-GERMAIN-EN-LAYE. Summary: Various Services for the Organization of the Fête Des Loges. Description: This framework agreement covers various services for the organization of the Fête des Loges. The Fête des Loges is a fairground event which takes place annually during the summer period. It is held at the location: Esplanade des Loges . Lot 2: Water network installation and management services The framework agreement consists of installing the water supply to the various bungalows and caravans of the Fête des Loges during the event. Lot 3: Office of control of facilities The framework agreement consists of verifying various installations located on the Esplanade des Loges by an approved inspection office. The festival includes 132 locations including 7 restaurants, 8 refreshment bars and 8 candy stores. These figures may vary from year to year. They will be provided to the service provider each year before the start of his mission. Lot 4: Removal, maintenance and reinstallation of safety barriers and/or concrete separators The annual service consists of the removal, maintenance and refitting of crash barriers and/or concrete separators. Doc Title: Various services for the organization of the Fête des Loges Contract Type: supplies. Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Various Services for the Organization of the Fête Des Loges

Summary: Restricted Project Management Competition for the Construction Project of a 30-Cradle Crèche in Soultzmattwintzfelden. The estimated budget for the work is set at €3,968,750 excluding tax, i.e. 4 €762,500 including tax. The successful bidder will be assigned the following mission(s): • Basic mission (art. R.2431-8 et seq. of the public procurement code): - Sketch (ESQ), - Summary preliminary project studies (APS), - Summary preliminary project studies (APD), - Administrative Authorizations (Building and demolition permits, prior authorizations, etc., - Project study (PRO), - Assistance provided to the project owner for the award of works contracts (AMT), - Examination of conformity to the study project execution and their visa when they were made by an economic operator responsible for the work (VISA), - Work execution management (DET), - Assistance with reception operations and during the guarantee of perfect completion (AOR). This mission basic is supplemented by the following mission elements, included in the market: • Additional missions - Energy Supply Feasibility Study (EFAE), - Security System Coordination...

Lot 2 Roads and Various Networks.... Description: Lyon 1 and 2 - Redevelopment of the quays of the Right Bank of the Rhône - Operational phase n°1: Wilson section / Passerelle du Collège and Voie Lyonnaise 6 in its entirety. Lot 2 Roads and various networks... Lyon 1 and 2 - Redevelopment of the Right Bank quays du Rhône - Operational section n°1: Wilson section / Passerelle du Collège and Voie Lyonnaise 6 in its entirety. Lot 2 Roads and various networks. Lot 3 Public lighting. Lot 4 Three-color light signaling. Lot 5 Green spaces-furniture-games. Batch 6 Civil engineering, heritage - High platforms. Lot 7 Civil engineering lower ports and plant engineering The project to requalify the right bank of the Rhône concerns the river frontage quays on the right bank of the Rhône from the Pont de Lattre de Tassigny to the Pont Gallieni, including the Guillotière bridge. These quays, located in the heart of the heritage sector of Lyon, are currently characterized by the predominance of the car with an almost motorway character. In this context, a significant potential for spaces could be freed from the omnipresence of the car and reassigned to new uses in a qualitative public space favorable to active mobility, public transport, economic, fun, recreational, sporting and cultural activities, reestablishing a link with the river and offering a generous plant landscape. Given the significant scope, this operation will take place over several mandates. These contracts concern the redevelopment of the quays of the Right Bank of the Rhône - Tranche operational n°1: Wilson section / Passerelle du Collège and Voie Lyonnaise 6 in its entirety. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: INTERCOMMUNAL UNION FOR DEVELOPMENT, RIVERS AND THE WATER CYCLE (SIARCE). Summary: Framework Agreement for Project Management Missions and Additional Missions for the Needs of Siarce - 2 Lots -. Description: Lot n°1: Project management missions and additional missions: Sanitation and drinking water Lot n°2: Project management missions and additional missions: Watercourses and wetlands Each batch will be the subject of a framework agreement. The framework agreement is intended for project management contracts whose estimate is higher than the threshold for contracts without advertising or competitive bidding (i.e. currently at 40,000.00 euro(s) excluding tax). It will be executed through the conclusion of subsequent contracts. The sub-criteria retained for the judgment of the offers are defined in the regulations of the consultation. The criteria for awarding subsequent contracts appear in the Specifications of Special Administrative Clauses. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: NEW COMMUNE OF SAINT-DENIS. Summary: Call for Tenders Open. Description: The framework agreement with purchase orders for the development of soil and soil pollution diagnostics and strategic support and technical expertise for polluted sites and soils is allocated in 3 lots. It will be concluded for a period of 1 year from the date of notification and tacitly renewable 3 times per period of 1 year, i.e. 4 years maximum. The total maximum amount of the framework agreement over its entire duration is 2,300,000 Euros excluding tax. Diagnoses and in-depth studies of soil pollution and soil emissions The mission aims to establish the history of the site concerned and its vulnerability, to identify the nature and quantity of pollutants present, with interpretation of the analysis results and formulation of recommendations, to analyze the compatibility of the site with the current or planned uses with regard to health issues, and to propose management measures adapted to the operation to treat or possibly control pollution. The framework agreement is for purchase orders, single-award with no minimum and with a annual maximum of 250,000 Euros excluding tax. It is concluded for a period of one year, renewable 3 times. Advice, assistance and technical expertise on polluted sites and soils The mission aims to assist the project owner on the theme of sites and soils polluted. The framework agreement is based on purchase orders, single-award with no minimum and an annual maximum of 125,000 Euros excluding tax. It is concluded for a period of one year, renewable 3 times. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PAYS DE LA LOIRE REGION. Summary: Framework Agreement for Project Management Assistance for the Preparation, Award and Monitoring of Operations-Performance Maintenance and Associated Services Contracts (Mempsa) for the Needs of Eps.... Description: Framework agreement for project management assistance for the preparation, award and monitoring of Operations-Performance Maintenance and Associated Services Contracts (MEMPSA) for the needs of EPs... The Pays de la Loire Region wishes to register fully in achieving the objectives of the Tertiary Eco Energy System (DEET) on its real estate assets. Local Public Education Establishments (EPLE) are particularly targeted because they alone represent a very large part of this heritage. These objectives for 2030, 2040 and 2050 involve actions to reduce regular, significant and long-term energy consumption. The operation and maintenance of sites thus represents a significant and obligatory lever of action. for their achievement. The main purpose of this intellectual service framework agreement is: -The carrying out of Project Management Assistance (AMO) missions to support the Pays de la Loire Region in defining the need, the development, award, execution and monitoring of performance operation and maintenance contracts for technical equipment (heating, domestic hot water, ventilation) of public high schools in the Region. Furthermore, this framework agreement intellectual services has the secondary object: -The provision of services associated with the achievement of the main object of the contract. The associated services may concern study and expertise missions, performance monitoring, supervision of works, training and all other services linked to the smooth running of the operation and maintenance of sites and the improvement of installations..... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-02-09. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Framework Agreement for Project Management Assistance for the Preparation, Award and Monitoring of Operations-Performance Maintenance and Associated Services Contracts (Mempsa) for the Needs of Eps...
output.Description: Framework agreement for project management assistance for the preparation, award and monitoring of Operations-Performance Maintenance and Associated Services Contracts (MEMPSA) for the needs of EPs... The Pays de la Loire Region wishes to register fully in achieving the objectives of the Tertiary Eco Energy System (DEET) on its real estate assets. Local Public Education Establishments (EPLE) are particularly targeted because they alone represent a very large part of this heritage. These objectives for 2030, 2040 and 2050 involve actions to reduce regular, significant and long-term energy consumption. The operation and maintenance of sites thus represents a significant and obligatory lever of action. for their achievement. The main purpose of this intellectual service framework agreement is: -The carrying out of Project Management Assistance (AMO) missions to support the Pays de la Loire Region in defining the need, the development, award, execution and monitoring of performance operation and maintenance contracts for technical equipment (heating, domestic hot water, ventilation) of public high schools in the Region. Furthermore, this framework agreement intellectual services has the secondary object: -The provision of services associated with the achievement of the main object of the contract. The associated services may concern study and expertise missions, performance monitoring, supervision of works, training and all other services linked to the smooth running of the operation and maintenance of sites and the improvement of installations....

The scope of operation includes two intermunicipalities: - the Community of Communes of Haute-Somme (CCHS); - the Community of communes Land of Picardy (TdP). The territory, the subject of the operation, brings together 103 municipalities and has approximately 44,451 inhabitants (INSEE, 2022). The scope could expand to the Community of Communes of the East of the Somme (CCES), bringing together 41 municipalities and counting 19 829 inhabitants. This extension is planned as part of an optional portion of the contract. The service consists of technical, financial and administrative support for home improvement projects for private owners. The number of file to be processed is specified in the CCTP. It also includes participation in steering meetings (COPIL), as well as various technical and information meetings, particularly as part of the communication of the system. TERRITORIAL PACT FRANCE RENOV' SHAPE NO3 Technical, financial and administrative support for work projects This contract concerns the monitoring and animation of component no. 3 of the Territorial Pact of the PETR Heart of Hauts-de-France. This framework agreement is divided into sections: * Firm phase: Scope of operation comprising two intercommunities: - Haute-Somme Community of Communes (CCHS); - Land of Picardy (TdP). * Optional section: "Integration of the new p.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-02-02. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Description: BIM Process Framework Agreement (BIM Project Management Assistance (AMO) lots, Digitization Lot and Modeling Lot). This framework agreement covers a set of intellectual services linked to the BIM process, applicable to all sites. Faced with technological developments, SIAAP wishes to rely on this contractual support to support its design and construction projects, as well as to ensure optimized management of its assets. It is structured into 3 lots: - Lots (Support Project Management (AMO) BIM, Digitization Lot and Modeling Lot) are framework agreements with multi-awarder purchase orders. The distribution of services by lot is as follows: * Project Management Assistance (AMO) BIM Lot Two types of missions are expected: 1- Support the project owner in the management of the project in the design and execution phases, from a BIM perspective 2- Support from management for structuring documents related to BIM, outside of specific projects. * Digitization Batch The purpose of this lot is to provide digitalization services, in particular the acquisition of point clouds (aerial, terrestrial, networks), with a view to modeling or analyzing assets. * Batch Modeling This lot allows the creation of 3D digital models integrating data from various sources (paper plans, CAD files, point clouds). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: INTERDEPARTMENTAL UNION FOR SANITATION IN THE PARIS METROPOLITAN AREA (SIAAP). Summary: Work to Create an Access Well to the Dplb. Description: Creation of an access shaft to the DPLB (Délestage du Pantin La Briche) as close as possible to the point of impact between the SIAAP structure and the tunnel boring machine of line 15 East of the Grand Paris Express. The DPLB is a unitary collector belonging to the SIAAP and managed by the DEA. This project concerns a portion of the DPLB, between R1 and R2, located at the intersection with the route of line 15 East of the Grand Paris Express. This intersection is located at the intersection of rue de la Maladrerie and rue Léopold Réchossière, on a section between R2+285 and R2+345, i.e. a section of approximately 60 linear meters. This section is located in the immediate vicinity of the point of impact of the tunnel boring machine and therefore constitutes a critical zone requiring secure access, for the purposes of inspections, monitoring and control before, during and after passage of the tunnel boring machine. The portion of the DPLB collector concerned is a reinforced concrete sanitation structure (voussoir type, 22cm thick) with a diameter of 3000 mm built in the 2000s. The well access will be made at the corner of rue Léopold Réchossière and rue de la Maladrerie, on a plot made available to the SGP. The location of the well will be within the area of ​​the future park managed by Plaine Commune. Work to create the well access includes: - soil injection work - earthworks, drying, civil engineering and equipment for the 2m x 2m well (15.50m deep) and its 2m x 1m gallery (10m long) - the r.... Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
